materials.raw_text: 12 grams of Aluminium (As), 11 grams of Cobalt (Co), 4 grams of Praseodymium (Pr), 9 grams of Ruthenium (Ru)

sourcing.instructions: Aluminium can be sourced from metal suppliers or hardware stores. Cobalt is available from specialty metal suppliers or online retailers. Praseodymium can be obtained through chemical supply companies or rare earth element suppliers. Ruthenium can be found at specialty metal suppliers or from online chemical suppliers.
steps: Aluminium can be sourced from metal suppliers or hardware stores. Cobalt is available from specialty metal suppliers or online retailers. Praseodymium can be obtained through chemical supply companies or rare earth element suppliers. Ruthenium can be found at specialty metal suppliers or from online chemical suppliers.

1. Weigh out the required amounts of each metal using a precision balance. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine the weighed metals. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to grind the mixture into a fine powder to ensure uniform distribution. 4. Transfer the mixed powders into a crucible suitable for high-temperature processes.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out the required amounts of each metal using a precision balance. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine the weighed metals. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to grind the mixture into a fine powder to ensure uniform distribution. 4. Transfer the mixed powders into a crucible suitable for high-temperature processes.

steps: 1. Preheat a furnace to 1500째C (2732째F). 2. Place the crucible with the powder mixture in the furnace. 3. Maintain the temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and homogenization of the materials.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a furnace to 1500째C (2732째F). 2. Place the crucible with the powder mixture in the furnace. 3. Maintain the temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and homogenization of the materials.

steps: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature. 2. This process should take approximately 6-8 hours to avoid thermal shock to the material.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature. 2. This process should take approximately 6-8 hours to avoid thermal shock to the material.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solidified sample from the crucible. 2. Use a belt sander or grinding machine to shape the sample to the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Polish the surface using fine-grit sandpaper to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to enhance durability and appearance.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the solidified sample from the crucible. 2. Use a belt sander or grinding machine to shape the sample to the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Polish the surface using fine-grit sandpaper to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to enhance durability and appearance.
